# First heading

## Second heading

document.title: Testing Out This Cool MDX Stuff
document.description: The “const” keyword in JavaScript is used to create constants, variables that can't change.  Curiously, though, we do seem to be able to edit objects and arrays that are created using “const”.  In this tutorial, we're going to dig into the incredibly-important distinction between “assignment” and “mutation” in JavaScript.

document.title: Welcome To The Blog!
document.description: Wait I have a blog now? Guess I might as well explain why! We'll also dig into some of the features, how it was built, and what to look forward to next. This post will cover building the basics of how I built my personal blog including: NextJS, Content Layer MDX, Tailwind and more.

body.raw:
# Howdy!

I'm Kevin! I'm a full-stack software engineer and homelab nerd. If you're visiting this blog, hopefully, you'll find something helpful! I am also writing this blog for a few more... selfish reasons. Effective communication through writing is a highly underrated skill for software developers. Writing allows us to share ideas, explain problems, and develop solutions. More importantly, it allows us to do it asynchronously saving us both time and effort. The problem is, writing is hard. It's a skill that takes practice and effort to hone into something actually useful

So, this blog is intended to be my excuse to get some practice writing about things I find fun and interesting. In the spirit of that async nature, it will also allow me to build up a portfolio of my knowledge and skills to point to for future job prospects. Like I said selfish reasons 😃.

For anyone who actually poked around the website, yes, yes I did steal that beginning part from my About Page. Async communication is another way of saying lazy communication so why not!

# The Blog

This blog is built using a number of open source frameworks and libraries.

 - [NextJS](https://nextjs.org/) for the main React framework and SSR and hosting
 - [MDX](https://mdxjs.com/) for writing blog posts in a Markdown file that can also use React Components
 - [ContentLayer](https://www.contentlayer.dev/) for ingesting and processing the MDX, and providing access to the posts through React
 - [TailwindCSS](https://tailwindcss.com/) for themeing and the overall CSS framework

body.raw:
Hello, Next.js!
 
You can import and use React components in MDX files.
